article.title: Pustulosis
article.text:
Pustulosis is highly inflammatory skin condition resulting in large fluid-filled blister-like areas - pustules. Pustulosis typically occurs on the palms of the hands and/or the soles of the feet. The skin of these areas peels and flakes (exfoliates).
This condition—also referred to as "palmo-plantar pustulosis"—is a feature of pustular psoriasis.


== See also ==
Acute generalized exanthematous pustulosis
Pustulosis palmaris et plantaris


== References ==

quiz:
Question 1:
                {question: "What is Pustulosis?"},
                {options : [{A: "A type of skin cancer"} , {B: "A highly inflammatory skin condition resulting in large fluid-filled blister-like areas"}, {C: "A type of hair loss"}, {D: "A type of nail disorder" }]},
                {answer: "B"}

Question 2:
                {question: "Where does Pustulosis typically occur?"},
                {options : [{A: "On the palms of the hands and/or the soles of the feet"} , {B: "On the face and neck"}, {C: "On the back and chest"}, {D: "On the legs and arms" }]},
                {answer: "A"}

Question 3:
                {question: "What is another term for Pustulosis?"},
                {options : [{A: "Acute generalized exanthematous pustulosis"} , {B: "Pustulosis palmaris et plantaris"}, {C: "Palmo-plantar pustulosis"}, {D: "Both B and C" }]},
                {answer: "D"}

Question 4:
                {question: "What happens to the skin in areas affected by Pustulosis?"},
                {options : [{A: "It becomes discolored"} , {B: "It peels and flakes"}, {C: "It becomes rough and dry"}, {D: "It develops a rash" }]},
                {answer: "B"}

Question 5:
                {question: "What is Pustulosis a feature of?"},
                {options : [{A: "Skin cancer"} , {B: "Eczema"}, {C: "Pustular psoriasis"}, {D: "Acne" }]},
                {answer: "C"}
